title: How to use 'people' less in an essay - Quora

response.answer_text: Use a pronoun – "they". For example: A crowd of people had gathered outside the building to protest the funding cuts. The people had banners and t-shirts that read "Save our library". At 10am, the people began chanting their slogan loudly. Awkward – why keep telling us they are people? We know it from the first sentence. A crowd of people had gathered outside the building to protest the funding cuts. The residents had banners and t-shirts that read "Save our library". At 10am, the citizens began chanting their slogan loudly. Beware replacing a perfectly good word with synonyms just for the sake of variation – this can get silly and is distracting or even confusing for the reader if it is done in a short section of text. Are we still talking about the same people? Elegant variation - Wikipedia Popular orange vegetables and silly synonyms A crowd of people had gathered outside the building to protest the funding cuts. They had banners and t-shirts that read "Save our library". At 10am, they began chanting their slogan loudly. Better – tell us that there are people involved once, then move to a pronoun. Restate "people" in the next paragraph, or if you move to another topic and then come back.

You can use a number of synonym wherever possible. One cannot use its synonyms such as community, society, public, crowd, citizens, inhabitants, social gatherings as the perfect fit to replace the word ‘people’. you can use the synonyms sparingly where they perfectly fit.

Use the word people fewer times by getting a thesaurus (see link) online or in print and study up on the synonyms for people. Do not stop with people. Use the thesaurus to broaden your vocabulary in general. Synonyms of people | Thesaurus.com
